hints.content:
We need to count how many pictures are across household items on the picture graph.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $\maroonD2$ pictures across from household items. 

$\maroonD2\times\purpleD5 = \maroonD{10}$

Ruby spent $\$\maroonD{10}$ on household items.

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Cost (in dollars) and the vertical axis labeled Type of purchase. Each item is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Clothing, Food, Toys, and Household items. The cost of each item is represented by the number of prices tags plotted on the graph. Clothing is represented by 6 price tags, Food is represented by 4 price tags, Toys is represented by 1 price tag, and Household Items is represented by 2 price tags. The price tags for Household items are labeled 1 and 2. !

hints.content:
Now we need to find how much money was spent on each item.

[[☃ image 1]]

Type of purchase | Number of ![A price tag.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7ad141ae076fe4ffb3f879a49ea8509ebb7f4c48) | Cost
:- | :-: | :-
$\maroonD{\text{Household items}}$ | $2$ | $2\times\$\purpleD{5} =\$\maroonD{10}$
$\blueD{\text{Toys}}$ | $1$ | $1\times\$\purpleD{5}=\$\blueD5$
$\greenD{\text{Food}}$ | $4$ | $4\times\$\purpleD{5} =\$\greenD{20}$
$\redD{\text{Clothing}}$ | $6$ | $6\times\$\purpleD{5} =\$\redD{30}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Cost (in dollars) and the vertical axis labeled Type of purchase. Each item is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Clothing, Food, Toys, and Household items. The cost of each item is represented by the number of prices tags plotted on the graph. Clothing is represented by 6 price tags, Food is represented by 4 price tags, Toys is represented by 1 price tag, and Household Items is represented by 2 price tags. The price tags for Household items are labeled 1 and 2. The price tag for Toys is labeled 1. The price tags for Food are labeled 1, 2, 3, and 4. The price tags for Clothing are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. !

hints.content:
Let's add to find out how much Ruby spent.

$\maroonD{10}+\blueD5+\greenD{20}+\redD{30}  = \purpleD{65}$

Ruby had a budget of up to $\$\goldE{75}$.  Let's subtract the amount Ruby spent to see how much she had left.

$\$\goldE{75} - \$\purpleD{65} = \$10$
Ruby had $\$10$ left from her budget.

question.content:
Ruby had a budget of up to $\$75$ to spend.  Ruby made a graph of the costs of the items she bought.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How much money did Ruby have left from her budget?** 

$\$$[[☃ input-number 1]]

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Cost (in dollars) and the vertical axis labeled Type of purchase. Each item is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Clothing, Food, Toys, and Household items. The cost of each item is represented by the number of prices tags plotted on the graph. Clothing is represented by 6 price tags, Food is represented by 4 price tags, Toys is represented by 1 price tag, and Household Items is represented by 2 price tags. !
